column1: id,"blog","category","markdown"

65,"WN272","Software","The [Directions API](https://graphhopper.com/#directions-api) of GraphHopper now supports [motorcycles, mountain bikes and road bikes](https://graphhopper.com/blog/2015/09/29/motorcycle-mountain-bike-and-more-on-graphhopper-maps/). The well-known Web application [Graph Hopper Maps](https://graphhopper.com/maps/) benefits from that. The carried out performance optimizations with [Graph Hopper 0.5](https://graphhopper.com/blog/2015/08/12/releasing-graphhopper-0-5/) have reduced the hardware claims such that more profiles  can be offered with the same server hardware of GraphHopper Directions API."

56,"WN272","Software","A new navigation app for Android systems: [Pocket Maps](http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Pocketmaps) based on Mapsforge (offline vector maps) and GraphHopper (routing). Attention: in PlayStore there are two apps with the same name."

338,"WN276","Software","Based on the routing engine Graphhopper, a new API for route optimization is [available](https://graphhopper.com/blog/2015/11/02/graphhopper-route-optimization-api-goes-beta/), so far in beta testing status."

362,"WN277","Programming","Via the blog from routing webservice Graphhopper there is a [description](https://graphhopper.com/blog/2015/11/09/how-does-graphhopper-send-out-traveling-salesmen/), how the Traveling Salesman problem is solved there."
440,"WN278","Did you know that…","... Graphhopper with [height profile and heights](https://graphhopper.com/maps/?point"

502,"WN279","Community","OpenCage Data Blog [publishes](http://blog.opencagedata.com/post/133365357663/open-geo-interview-peter-karich-graphhopper) an interview with [Peter Karich](https://twitter.com/timetabling), one of the creators of Graphhopper. [Graphhopper](https://graphhopper.com/) is a routing service which is based on  OpenStreetMap data."

481,"WN279","Community","Is it possible to solve James Joyce's puzzle and travel through Dublin's inner city without passing a pub? A few years ago Rory McCann [proved](http://www.kindle-maps.com/blog/how-to-walk-across-dublin-without-passing-a-pub-full-publess-route-here.html) that it was. Now karussel is [trying](https://graphhopper.com/blog/2015/11/15/publess-routes-graphhopper-edition/) it too using Graphhopper. He's found a 5.8 km route instead of the original 7.3 km one. In another post he [shows](https://graphhopper.com/blog/2015/11/18/visiting-every-pub-in-dublin/) how to calculate a route passing _all_ pubs. This route is 38 km long (estimated 7¾ h on foot). With this he [made](https://twitter.com/timetabling/status/667328637897691136) it on the Hacker News front page (and in the comments there you'll see some familar OSM names too)."

703,"WN282","Maps","[""Roads to Rome""](http://roadstorome.moovellab.com/countries)  by [Benedikt Groß](http://benedikt-gross.de/log/), [Philipp Schmitt](http://philippschmitt.com/)  & [moovel Lab](http://lab.moovel.com/)  is a data viz project exploring one of the biggest unsolved quests of mobility: Do all roads really lead to Rome? :) More details and how to redefined the territorial extents of the EU and US based on travel times under the project page. The routing was done on the basis of [OSM data](http://www.geofabrik.de/data/download.html) & [GraphHopper](https://graphhopper.com/). What does it mean - [roads to Rome](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/all_roads_lead_to_Rome)?"
795,"WN284","Software","Summary of all [GraphHopper](https://graphhopper.com/blog/2015/12/23/graphhopper-2015/) related activities for the year 2015."

1031,"WN288","Did you know that…","... Graph Hopper can also be used for visualization/analysis of correlations in [major road networks](https://graphhopper.com/blog/2016/01/19/alternative-roads-to-rome/)? Keyword [Shortest Path tree](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/K%C3%BCrzester_Pfad) and [MOSPF](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/MOSPF)."
1142,"WN290","Releases","

column5: Night mode, update map and routing engine, various improvements
Many smaller changes, new alternate route calculation
column6: 2257,WN310","Events","On the 13th of July there [will](https://graphhopper.com/blog/2016/06/27/graphhopper-meetup-berlin-july/) be a GraphHopper meetup in Berlin."

column1: 2221,"WN310","Programming","The Routing API of GraphHopper has [just received](https://graphhopper.com/blog/2016/06/15/graphhopper-directions-api-news-june/) a bunch of new features."
2227,"WN310","Releases","

column5: Java 7 support, new translations and many more

column1: provided by the [OSM Software Watchlist](https://osm.wno-edv-service.de/index.php/osm-software)"
2404,"WN313","Community","[1] Graphhopper [is seeking](https://twitter.com/graphhopper/status/752448767580860417) help for coding as well as for translations."
3228,"WN328","Releases","

column5: Many changes, please read release info.
Many changes, please read release info.
Alternative routes, round trips, various improvements
This release contains a variety of fixes from 9.6.0.
Patch release that addresses four regressions in the v3.19.0 release.
Fixed a typo and a formatting issue, handle a plain 00:00-24:00 opening hour specification as being ""always open"" for POIs
New camera mode: Auto, Compatibility fix for latest Ricoh Theta S firmware.
New Style Editor, CSS Styling Improvements and many more.
New maps, this time of Europe and Middle East.

column1: Provided by the [OSM Software Watchlist](https://osm.wno-edv-service.de/index.php/osm-software).
( ) unfree software. See [freesoftware](https://fsfe.org/about/basics/freesoftware.en.html)."

4718,"WN361","Programming","Graphhopper [is looking for](https://discuss.graphhopper.com/t/looking-for-graphhopper-experts/2056) freelancers or companies interested in implementing customizations of the GraphHopper routing engine, jsprit or integrating the GraphHopper Directions API in an application or process."

4894,"WN364","Releases","Version 0.9 of the Graphhopper routing engine was [released](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2017/05/31/graphhopper-routing-engine-0-9-released/) on May 31. There are a couple of highlights: public transport routing, and a new ""hybrid mode"" which is intended to support fast routing queries as well as support for turn costs and restrictions.  Graphhopper is now also available on [osm.org](http://www.openstreetmap.org/directions?engine=graphhopper_car&route=48.5510%2C7.6700%3B48.5671%2C7.8315#map=13/48.5500/7.7435) as a car profile, in addition to the existing bicycle & pedestrian profiles."
5207,"WN369","Picture","![Text](http://www.weeklyosm.eu/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/369_EN.jpg =790x611)
GraphHopper's new flexible routing is at least 15 times faster [^1^](#369_15718)

5208,"WN369","Software","[1] Peter Karich [reported](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2017/08/14/flexible-routing-15-times-faster/) a substantial speed up in routing in [GraphHopper](https://www.graphhopper.com/) with the new ""landmark"" algorithm."
5462,"WN374","Other Geo Things","Nothing for nerds, but a nice [advertising video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7M63P1P5lKw) for the GraphHopper API."

5446,"WN374","Programming","The OpenRouteService backend is now available under the Apache license [on Github](https://github.com/GIScience/openrouteservice). As this is a GraphHopper fork, the ORS was eventually converted from its own implementation to a GraphHopper-based system in recent years."

5611,"WN377","Other Geo Things","How are urban areas in Australia [connected](https://twitter.com/tjukanov/status/916373754468585477) with Sydney. Topi Tjukanov visualized it using QGIS, GraphHopper and OpenStreetMap data."
6076,"WN388","Picture","![speed Graphhopper](http://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads//2017/12/388_T_EN.jpg =688x393)
Display all different maximum allowed speed values along the path  [^1^](#388_16647)

6079,"WN388","Programming","The latest version of GraphHopper's Routing API [offers](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2017/12/19/december-news-graphhopper/) new capabilities: path details and an “avoid” feature. Other GraphHopper APIs also receive updates."

6232,"WN392","Programming","Robin Boldt, who runs Kurviger.de, [reports](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2018/01/18/mapzen-alternatives-kurviger/) in a guest article in the Graphhopper blog about their migration from Mapzen to the competitors and about which problems vector tile customers have to cope with."
6543,"WN399","Releases","Version 0.10 of the open source routing engine GraphHopper [has been released](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/karussell/diary/43461) on March 8th."

6992,"WN409","Software","Michael from Graphhopper [presents](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2018/05/16/real-time-public-transit-routing/) a demo of their new real-time public transit routing feature. His blog post unveils a few technical details behind the scenes."

7261,"WN416","Programming","Peter Karich from the company GraphHopper, [wrote](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2018/07/04/high-precision-reachability/) a blog post about the visualisation of road network reachability with deck.gl. Although network reachability visualisation is nothing new, the blog post describes how you can create fancy visualisations of reachability yourself."
7819,"WN426","Picture","![Pic](http://www.weeklyosm.eu/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/246_T_EN.jpg =500x430)
Reachability in 5 (green) and 10 minutes (blue) - Open source module from GraphHopper [[1]](#wn425_18355)

7804,"WN426","Releases","[1] The GraphHopper project [announced](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2018/09/17/graphhopper-routing-engine-0-11-release-open-sourcing-the-isochrone-module/) the release 0.11 of its routing engine. A major milestone is the open sourcing of the isochrone module. The isochrone API can calculate the reachable area based on limiting factors such as time, travel mode, and origin. Other improvements include the public transit module, the introduction of an open source navigation library and faster map matching."

9155,"WN454","Releases","Version 0.12 of the GraphHopper Routing Engine [has been released](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2019/03/26/graphhopper-routing-engine-0-12-released/). Turn restrictions and turn costs are now supported in the speed mode, the Isochrone module was made compatible with public transit and the average speed calculation was improved."

10131,"WN475","Other Geo Things","Do you know the expression [""All roads lead to Rome!""](https://www.move-lab.com/projects/roads-to-rome?utm_source=subdomain&utm_medium=redirect&utm_campaign=rebrand)? The website [Move_Lab](https://www.move-lab.com/) has developed the project [Roads To Rome](http://roadstorome.moovellab.com/) which proves that this is true. (we [reported 282](http://www.weeklyosm.eu/en/archives/6388/#wn282_roads_to_rome), [ 284](http://www.weeklyosm.eu/en/archives/6538/#wn284_open-geo-interview-raphael-reimann-roads-to), [285](http://www.weeklyosm.eu/en/archives/6580/#wn285_roads_to_rome,_2nd_edition_subtitle_all_roads_start_in_paris), [415](http://www.weeklyosm.eu/en/archives/10481/#wn415_17825)) All roads to Rome, and all other routes calculated during the course of this project have been navigated by the [GraphHopper](https://www.graphhopper.com/). The routing was based on OpenStreetMap data."
11798,"WN512","Picture","![lead picture](https://weeklyosm.eu/wp-content/uploads/sites/4/2020/05/511_T_.png =1024x)
GraphHopper needs feedback - people can influence the route of GraphHopper. [^1^](#wn512_22453)

11812,"WN512","Programming","[1] GraphHopper [needs](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2020/05/06/get-started-with-customizable-routing/) feedback for a new feature where even people without programming or Java knowledge can influence the routes produced by GraphHopper."
11896,"WN514","Releases","[Version 1](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2020/05/25/graphhopper-routing-engine-1-0-released/) of routing engine GraphHopper has been released."

11924,"WN515","OpenStreetMap Foundation","OSMF and GraphHopper [have published](https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2020/06/01/osmf-and-graphhopper-joint-press-release-graphhopper-routing-engine-1-0-released/) a joint press release announcing the release of version 1.0 of the open source GraphHopper routing engine after 7 years of development."

12300,"WN522","Community","In Geomob Podcast #24 Ed Freyfogle [interviews](https://thegeomob.com/podcast/episode-24) Peter Karich, co-founder of routing software maker [Graphhopper](https://www.graphhopper.com/). Graphhopper is a unique success story – they have built a thriving business on top of an open-source software project and OpenStreetMap data."
12787,"WN533","Releases","Version 2.0 of the open source GraphHopper routing engine has been [released](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2020/09/30/graphhopper-routing-engine-2-0-released/)."

14220,"WN566","Software","The Graphhopper routing engine [has been updated to version 3.0](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2021/05/18/graphhopper-routing-engine-3-0-released/). The new version allows the visualisation of route details, a tool to place a GPX track on routes already on the map has been added, and the performance of isochronous maps and general performance have been improved."

14877,"WN585","Software","Version 4.0 of the GraphHopper routing engine has been [released](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2021/09/29/graphhopper-routing-engine-4-0-released/). ‘Spatial rules’ have been replaced and extended with custom areas. You can use custom areas to customise properties of GraphHopper’s road network in arbitrary areas. A typical use case is to amend rules on a country-by-country basis, such as default speed limits."

15341,"WN599","Software","[GraphHopper Maps for Android](https://github.com/boldtrn/graphhopper-maps-capacitor) is a Capacitor-wrapper ([Capacitor](https://capacitorjs.com/) is an open source native runtime for building web apps) for the navi branch of [GraphHopper Maps](https://f-droid.org/en/packages/com.graphhopper.maps/), which provides directions and (experimental) turn-by-turn navigation for car, bicycle and foot. There are many known limitations for the turn-by-turn navigation feature (which are also in the browser version)."

15375,"WN600","Open Data","In GraphHopper's GitHub repository [open-traffic-collection](https://github.com/graphhopper/open-traffic-collection) there are URLs to traffic information portals containing open data. Maybe this is the beginning of OpenStreetMap based navigation with traffic jam avoidance?"

16264,"WN624","Software","Do you [want](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2022/06/27/host-your-own-worldwide-route-calculator-with-graphhopper/) your own worldwide route calculator? You get that with GraphHopper! Just try it."

16419,"WN630","Software","Tobias Zwick (westnordost, the main developer of StreetComplete) is currently [working](https://github.com/westnordost/osm-legal-default-speeds) to [improve](https://github.com/graphhopper/graphhopper/issues/2392) speed limit detection for OSM-based routing. There [is](https://westnordost.github.io/osm-legal-default-speeds/) an interactive demonstration to try out the API."

16571,"WN635","Software","GraphHopper has [released](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2022/09/19/graphhopper-routing-engine-6-0-released/) version 6.0 of their routing engine. This update offers faster route calculation, more flexibility, better instructions, and developer documentation."

16877,"WN643","Maps","Peter Karich, co-founder of GraphHopper, [announced](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2022/11/08/the-new-graphhopper-maps/) the release of GraphHopper Maps, a web-based route planner powered by the GraphHopper routing engine."

16933,"WN645","Releases","karussell [announced](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/karussell/diary/400437) the release of a new version of [GraphHopper](https://graphhopper.com/maps/) with a completely rewritten frontend that supports alternative routes, includes the custom model feature, works on mobile devices and has many more features. You can [read](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2022/11/08/the-new-graphhopper-maps/) more about this in the GraphHopper blog."
17536,"WN661","Picture","![lead picture](https://weeklyosm.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/661_T_all.png =997x537)
GraphHopper's new Routing Engine 7.0 [[^1^](#wn661_28306)]

17516,"WN661","Releases","GraphHopper has [released](https://github.com/graphhopper/graphhopper/releases/tag/7.0) its Routing Engine 7.0. In their blog, Peter Karich [presented](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2023/03/14/graphhopper-routing-engine-7-0-released/) some of the highlights: the handling of more complex turn restrictions, customisable routing, and visualising changes to areas."

17624,"WN664","Software","[Achim Domma](https://twitter.com/achimdomma) has pointed out a tweet by [Katharina Nocum](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katharina_Nocun). In this tweet, the publicist and net activist [complains](https://twitter.com/kattascha/status/1537511718095659008) that pedestrian routing wants to route her through an unlit park at 3 am. Manfred Reiter takes up the problem (in Mastodon) and [refers to](https://social.saarland/@derFred/110163786522921477) possibilities of improving the data through [Mapathons](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Mapathon), organised mapping like the UK [quarterly project](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/UK_Quarterly_Project/2023/2023_Q1_Project:_Fixmes_and_Notes), or [MapRoulette](https://www.maproulette.org/). He directly addresses the publishers of [OsmAnd](https://osmand.net/) and [Graphhopper](https://www.graphhopper.com/open-source/). It will be interesting to see which app tackles this problem first, or whether [Organic Maps](https://organicmaps.app/) will come out on top."

17768,"WN669","Releases","Peter [explained](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2023/05/02/graphhopper-maps-comes-with-better-custom-model-support/) the use of the 'route hint' and 'custom model' features of the GraphHopper application."
18062,"WN678","Releases","The GraphHopper Maps Android app [released](https://f-droid.org/packages/com.graphhopper.maps/) a new version and it can be found in the F-Droid app store."

18552,"WN692","Community","After having announced the release of GraphHopper in the Fediverse and X at the same time, karussell [noted](https://chaos.social/@karussell/111263237617946797) that the amount of engagement he got in the Fediverse was much more than on X."

18544,"WN692","Releases","Version 8.0 of the GraphHopper route engine has been [released](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2023/10/18/graphhopper-routing-engine-8-0-released/). Now it will take into account speed limits for different countries, even if there is no explicit `maxspeed` tag in OpenStreetMap. Kazakh and Uzbek translations have been added. Data structures have also been adapted to increase the speed of importing OSM data, which is constantly growing."
19300,"WN710","Software","Peter [explained](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2024/02/27/osmand-with-graphhopper-navigation/) how to use GraphHopper to calculate navigation routes in the OSMAnd app."

19648,"WN718","OSM in action","Jacek Gęborys has [created](https://www.reddit.com/r/MapPorn/comments/1c8nns5/rail_transit_availability_within_walking_distance/) several maps visualising the accessibility of railway stations in various major cities. He [used](https://en.osm.town/@karussell@chaos.social/112303960971144517) QGIS with OpenStreetMap as a source for the stops, in particular with the Overpass API, which allows you to automate the fetching of data and GraphHopper for calculating isochrones."

19665,"WN718","Releases","GraphHopper version 9.0 has been [released](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2024/04/23/graphhopper-routing-engine-9-0-released/). It comes with an improved GPX export, updated translations, many bug fixes, more route hints, and conditional access information."

20159,"WN730","Releases","GraphHopper has [introduced](https://chaos.social/@karussell/112734598199995625) a user-friendly update to its mapping service, 'Route Planning Step-by-Step', which allows walkers and cyclists to easily create and modify routes by right-clicking or long-pressing on the map to set start and end points and add additional locations. This update [improved](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2024/07/05/route-planning-step-by-step/) route customisation directly on desktop and mobile devices, making the planning process more intuitive and flexible."

20830,"WN746","Releases","Peter [announced](https://www.graphhopper.com/blog/2024/11/05/graphhopper-routing-engine-10-0-released/) the release of GraphHopper Routing Engine version 10.0. This release fixed a long-standing issue with u-turn routing, added several improvements to turn restriction implementations, and included an enhanced version of GraphHopper Maps with text search functionality."

21312,"WN756","Programming","Swiggy Bytes’s two-part blog series explored leveraging OpenStreetMap data for hyperlocal delivery routing by evaluating road quality and using machine learning to detect and fix issues. [Part 1](https://bytes.swiggy.com/the-osm-distance-service-part-1-evaluation-metrics-and-routing-configurations-6e8686ca814f) introduced the OSM-APLS and delta-coverage metrics to evaluate OSM's road accuracy. By analysing delivery trips, they identified routing configurations, concluding that the 'motorcycle short-fastest' mode was optimal for accurate distance calculations using GraphHopper. [Part 2](https://bytes.swiggy.com/the-osm-distance-service-part-2-fixing-roads-90bd6d3bb60f) presented a machine learning pipeline to detect missing roads, connectivity issues, and incorrect travel directions in OSM. Using unsupervised and self-supervised approaches, the system flagged and fixed errors, improving coverage and accuracy of road networks."
